This page is about making some plotly examples of dataset `Instacart`.

-----------------------------------------------

```{r setup, message = FALSE, echo = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(plotly)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.width = 6,
  fig.asp = .6,
  out.width = "90%",
  message = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE
)

theme_set(theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "bottom"))

options(
  ggplot2.continuous.colour = "viridis",
  ggplot2.continuous.fill = "viridis"
)

scale_colour_discrete = scale_colour_viridis_d
scale_fill_discrete = scale_fill_viridis_d
```

## Import the data

```{r}
data("instacart")
ins_raw <- instacart
```

## Data cleaning

```{r}
# Find 1% * Total Sale Volume (TSV)
num1 <- 
  floor(nrow(ins_raw) * .01)

# Find customers who contributed 1% of TSV
top1_cust <- 
  ins_raw %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  group_by(user_id) %>% 
  summarize(num = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(num)) %>% 
  mutate(
    cum = cumsum(num)
  ) %>% 
  filter(cum <= num1)

ins_df <- 
  ins_raw %>% 
  filter(user_id %in% pull(top1_cust, user_id)) %>% 
  select(2:5, 8, 9, 11, 12, 14) %>% 
  mutate(
    order_dow_new = weekdays(as.Date("2021-10-31") + 0:6)[order_dow + 1]
  )
```
